messages.content: What does ComfyUI-seamless-tiling offer in terms of functionality?
ComfyUI-seamless-tiling offers nodes for generating seamless textures and replicates the 'Tiling' option from A1111, including independent X/Y tiling.
What nodes should I use between the loader and samplers to modify a model?
You should use the 'Seamless Tile' node between the loader and samplers to modify a model.
Is there a more efficient way to decode an image with the 'Make Circular VAE' or 'Circular VAE Decode' node?
Yes, 'Make Circular VAE' is more efficient because it only modifies the VAE model once instead of on each decode.
What node can I use to check for seams?
You can use the 'Offset Image' node to check for seams.
Where is the Circular VAE Decode code from?
The Circular VAE Decode code is from the https://github.com/FlyingFireCo/tiled_ksampler repository.
What repository was the X/Y tiling implementation modified from?
The X/Y tiling implementation was modified from https://github.com/tjm35/asymmetric-tiling-sd-webui.
What is the list of nodes provided by ComfyUI-seamless-tiling?
The nodes provided by ComfyUI-seamless-tiling are 'conditioning/Seamless Tile', 'latent/Circular VAE Decode (tile)', 'latent/Make Circular VAE', and 'image/Offset Image'.
